page.title: 10Longdon Primary School
page.content:
It is Voluntary-aided; the children attend church and the vicar visits the school weekly. The {45 children}come from {Longdon, Bushley}and{Queenhill. In July, 8 left: Sept. intake is 5. There are{two full-time teachers}and one part-time ancillary help. The school house adjoins the school and is a listed building. Special emphasis is given to{rural {studies. }Vegetables are grown by the children and reports are made to Pershore Agricultural College on growth habits and flavour. Bees and hens are kept.
Following a succession of annual visits to the Lake District the school did a project on the River Amazon Rain Forest and their work is currently on display at the Forestry Commission Visitors centre at Grisedale, Cumbria.
